Vulnerability.Title: ksh bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: KornShell (KSH) is a Unix shell developed by AT&T Bell Laboratories, which is backward-compatible with the Bourne shell (sh) and includes many features of the C shell. The most recent version is KSH-93. KornShell complies with the POSIX.2 standard (IEEE Std 1003.2-1992). This update fixes the following bug: Previously, the ksh shell did not handle "out of disk space" errors correctly, which could lead to ksh unexpected termination, and a "No space left on device" error message returned. A patch has been provided to fix this bug, and ksh no longer crashes when the disk becomes full. (BZ#1227420) Users of ksh are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
